text: Yes <@U06CE73A00J>, In HubSpot Enterprise plans only having Custom Objects, Thats also limited to 10 custom objects
Yes is there an API endpoint that can be used to determine which plan an account is ?

No way to get the details of the account plan, You have to ask your customer to provide What Hub do you have like that

Eg, HubSpot Professional, HubSpot Enterprise using Radio button like that
In API call custom object create api, if it's success then they have enterprise plan, Getting any error The Hub don't have custom object plan. It's simple logic in backend you can get it
Right now HubSpot don't have the expected feature. We have to provide the exact date in the filter object

I am worried about rate limits on avoidable requests like when they don’t have custom objects. Anyways Thanks for the reply. I also doubt taking user input is ideal, there is no real validation to it.
Yes, I Agree, in my previous use case i did same way. Asking customer is easy to get the solution

If you have HubSpot enterprise plan using workflow you can trigger the Webhook, No need custom code, If you want to build any custom logic use custom code and call the Webhook. Note: Custom code execution should complete within 5 seconds
<@U01GW2U4WMA> Yes Only super admin can install apps
Thanks
<@U06E57ANWV9> Legacy API Version having that feature, By default it returns all the properties, From V3 onwards that feature removed, We have to specify the required properties in the request
Thanks, <@U06F0VD6S2G> -  with the Webhook approach, do you know if that will support authentication with GCP (with IAP)?
I do have HubSpot Enterprise, so i have the webhook functionality

<@U06FT4APCDP> I'm not sure about GCP API's, If GCP API's having that feature then you can implement in HubSpot workflow. As i remember GCP only supports OAuth and Service accounts. So need to refresh the access token every 30 mins once, for this i'm not sure about this

Hi Thomas, Here is an article about this for you. <https://help.hubdo.com/dopricer/set-deal-amount> It looks like there are some HubSpot features which are falling on each other causing your deal amount not to update properly. If you want to disable this feature and then sum up the total of your line items and send it also through the API that is another solution that does not depend on the workflow engine within HubSpot (may be advisable).
hmmm interesting, thanks
Yes. Line Items and how they work are an interest area of mine specifically so I am happy to collaborate on this if you need additional help. Thank you!
Is there an API where I can access the private app api logs? We’re getting a lot of 400s and 500s and I want to surface these errors to our observability platforms.
